poem:
**Mounjaro's Pause**

On the precipice of pounds,  
ambition halts—  
where profit curves,  
and bodies—eager—  
wait.

A climb, steepened,  
as coin stirs the air,  
demand teetering  
on the edge  
of promise and  
purse.

In halls of commerce,  
wheels whisper  
the cost of lean desires,  
as numbers  
feast.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mounjaro maker pauses shipments of weight loss drug to UK The manufacturer of the weight-loss drug Mounjaro has paused shipments to the UK before a significant price rise for the treatment next month. The US pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly is due to increase the UK list price of the drug by up to 170% from September amid a White House push to get drugmakers to raise medicine prices in Europe to allow for price cuts". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Mounjaro maker pauses shipments of weight loss drug to UK The manufacturer of the weight-loss drug Mounjaro has paused shipments to the UK before a significant price rise for the treatment next month. The US pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly is due to increase the UK list price of the drug by up to 170% from September amid a White House push to get drugmakers to raise medicine prices in Europe to allow for price cuts
